title: Jupyter Notebooks in Quarto
text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

mtcars = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/mtcars.csv")


plt.scatter(x=mtcars.wt, y=mtcars.mpg)
plt.title("Miles per Gallon vs Weight")
plt.show()








The heavier the vehicle, the worse the gas mileage!

title: Examples
text:
Assume the popular “mtcars” dataset was shared for the weekly data science drill. Below are some ways you could visualize and share your work so others can see how you did it.










Quarto Documents





This page was created from a .qmd file!





Jun 21, 2024


Bletchley












Jupyter Notebooks in Quarto





This page was created from a Jupyter notebook!





Jun 21, 2024


Bletchley






No matching items

title: Quarto Documents
text:
Quarto allows us to add computations from a variety of languages to our markdown-like documents.
Below is an R code block followed by its output:

library(ggplot2)

mtcars |>
    ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
    geom_point() +
    labs(title = "Miles per Gallon vs Weight")








Below is a Python code block followed by its output:

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

mtcars = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/mtcars.csv")

plt.scatter(x=mtcars.wt, y=mtcars.mpg)
plt.title("Miles per Gallon vs Weight")
plt.show()

title: Jupyter Notebooks in Quarto
text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

mtcars = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/mtcars.csv")

plt.scatter(x=mtcars.wt, y=mtcars.mpg)
plt.title("Miles per Gallon vs Weight")
plt.show()








The heavier the vehicle, the worse the gas mileage!
